title: 107_s2449
content: The Act titled "Federal Responsibility for Immigrant Health Act of 2002" allows federal payments under Medicaid for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens. The Social Security Act is amended to include necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions, pregnancy-related services, and communicable disease testing or treatment for certain aliens. Additionally, states have the option to eliminate residency requirements for these aliens under Medicaid. The Social Security Act is amended to include care for emergency medical conditions, pregnancy-related services, and communicable disease testing for certain aliens. States can choose to waive residency requirements for these aliens under Medicaid. The amendments apply to medical assistance provided after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is amended to provide $25,000,000 for fiscal years 1998 through 2001 and $50,000,000 for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The determination of state allotments is also revised to include specific guidelines for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will calculate allotments for the 15 States with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003 through 2007 based on the ratio of undocumented aliens in each State. The amount of allotment to a State for a fiscal year is determined based on the percentage of undocumented aliens in the State compared to all States. The allotment not paid out in a fiscal year is available for payment in the following year. The percentage of undocumented aliens in a State is based on the most recent estimates of the illegal alien population. The allotment to each State is determined based on the percentage of undocumented aliens in the State compared to all States. The Secretary will pay amounts to hospitals and providers of emergency health services for undocumented aliens based on State plans submitted. The State plan, submitted to the Secretary, will allocate funds to hospitals and providers of emergency health services for undocumented aliens in areas impacted by health costs. Payments will be based on each eligible hospital's payments for emergency medical services under the approved State plan or an alternative proxy for measuring the volume of emergency health services. The State plan will allocate funds to hospitals and providers for emergency health services for undocumented aliens based on payments for emergency medical services or an alternative proxy for measuring service volume. Definitions and special rules apply to hospitals and providers, including physicians and entities offering emergency ambulance services. The term 'provider' includes physicians, health care professionals, and entities offering emergency ambulance services. Providers related to a hospital furnish emergency health services to the same individuals. Payments under this subsection cannot replace federal payments to states for emergency medical services under title XIX of the Social Security Act. The amendments made under title XIX of the Social Security Act for reimbursement of emergency medical services shall apply starting fiscal year 2003. Permitting states and localities to provide healthcare to all individuals. The amendment to Section 411 of the Act excludes health benefits provided to individuals from the definition of assistance. The amendment excludes health benefits provided to individuals from the definition of assistance, effective for health care furnished before, on, or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
